title: Quiz 3: Abnormal Bleeding & Endometriosis
description: Test your understanding of abnormal uterine bleeding patterns and endometriosis.

questions.question: Match the bleeding disorder with its definition:

pairs.right: Normal menstruation occurs too often (short cycles)

questions.explanation: Standard definitions: Menorrhagia (heavy), Metrorrhagia (irregular), Epimenorrhoea (frequent), Hypomenorrhoea (scanty).

questions.question: What is 'Adenomyosis'?

options.text: Endometrial tissue invading the myometrium (internal endometriosis)

questions.explanation: Adenomyosis is internal endometriosis where endometrial tissue invades the uterine muscle (myometrium).
questions.hint: Break down the word: Adeno (gland) + myo (muscle).

questions.question: Dysfunctional Uterine Bleeding (DUB) is diagnosed by ___BLANK___ of organic conditions such as infection, trauma, or fibroids.
questions.explanation: DUB is a diagnosis of exclusion; you must rule out organic causes first.
questions.hint: It means ruling out everything else first.

questions.question: Which of the following are physical signs of Endometriosis? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Endometriosis presents with tender fixed masses, 'chocolate cysts', and pain/dyspareunia. Painless bleeding is NOT a sign.
questions.hint: Endometriosis is associated with pain and adhesions.

questions.question: Menorrhagia is a disease, not a symptom.
questions.explanation: Menorrhagia is a SYMPTOM, not a disease. To treat it, one must find the underlying cause (e.g., fibroids).
questions.hint: Is fever a disease or a symptom? Apply the same logic.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common cause of Metrorrhagia?
questions.explanation: Polyps, incomplete abortion, and cancer can cause irregular bleeding (metrorrhagia).
questions.hint: Think of structural growths that can bleed easily.

questions.question: What surgical procedure is often curative for menorrhagia if no other abnormality is found?
questions.explanation: Dilatation and curettage (D&C) can be curative for menorrhagia by removing the lining.
questions.hint: A minor surgical procedure often used for diagnosis and treatment of uterine issues.

questions.question: Order the steps for managing a patient with Metrorrhagia:
questions.hint: Follow the standard clinical assessment flow.

questions.question: What is the effect of pregnancy on Endometriosis?

options.text: It often has a curative/suppressive effect
It causes the cysts to rupture

questions.explanation: Pregnancy suppresses the condition (due to lack of menstruation) and often has a curative effect.
questions.hint: Endometriosis relies on the menstrual cycle.

questions.question: Endometriosis is most common in women who have had many children early in life.
questions.explanation: Endometriosis is strangely common in social groups where childbearing is DELAYED to late 20s/30s.
questions.hint: Think about the 'career woman' demographic often cited.
